channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11903] Directly invoking split & merge of replica regions should be disallowed
item.description: When the primary is split/merged the secondaries follow suit. We should disallow calling split/merge on the secondaries directly.
item.summary: Directly invoking split & merge of replica regions should be disallowed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I edited the subject to make it more clear (undo if I have it wrong DD)

stack, on the summary change, thanks.

Patch attached.

Looks good overall.
Some minor comments:


+    if (pair.getFirst().getReplicaId() != HRegionInfo.DEFAULT_REPLICA_ID)

+      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't invoke merge on non-default regions directly");

Including region name / replicaId in exception message would be nice.


+          for (HRegionLocation h : rl.getRegionLocations()) {

+            if (h != null && encodedName.equals(h.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName())) {

+              sn = h.getServerName();

+              info = h.getRegionInfo();

+              matched = true;

+            }

Looks like you can break out of the for loop after match is found.

This message is automatically generated.

In HBaseAdmin#mergeRegions():


+    Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName> pair = getRegion(encodedNameOfRegionA);

+    if (pair.getFirst().getReplicaId() != HRegionInfo.DEFAULT_REPLICA_ID)

+      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't invoke merge on non-default regions directly");

+    pair = getRegion(encodedNameOfRegionB);

+    if (pair.getFirst().getReplicaId() != HRegionInfo.DEFAULT_REPLICA_ID)

Please check that pair.getFirst() is not null - the above test failure was due to NPE since the regions to be merged are unknown.
This patch is for 0.98 branch. Attaching for reference.
